definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: Therefore, he facilitates IBM and the software company positively achieves a series of agreements.
sentences.chinese: 因而，他積極促成IBM與軟件公司告竣一系列協議。

sentences.english: The jury was unable to reach a unanimous decision.
sentences.chinese: 陪審團未能告竣定見一致的裁決。

sentences.english: If we do not agree on the outline, any text is useless.
sentences.chinese: 在我們就提綱告竣一致以前，寫正文是沒有意義的。

sentences.english: He early on there was this idea that after 32 years, finally fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 他早年就有此念頭，顛末了三十二年關於告竣心願。

sentences.english: It's wonderful to know that you have completed the dream of a lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 非常歡欣得知你告竣了一生的理想。

sentences.english: The contract contains basically all we have agreed upon during our negotiations.
sentences.chinese: 這個合同根本上席捲了全部我們在談判中所告竣協定。

sentences.english: She made the promise but she could not keep it.
sentences.chinese: 她許諾不再去了，但她無法告竣她的諾言。

sentences.english: The two sides agreed on a cease-fire.

definition: to build (for the first time)/to create (a building)
variant of 捐資|捐资[juan1 zi1]
to reconstruct/to repair/to revamp/to revise/to retake a failed course
to attend/to take office/to be present (in administrative capacity)
a record of events inscribed on a tablet
